'No reason to be surprised' Ukraine's Defence Minister said his country will be using its military might to defend itself against any Russian encroachment
'The most effective way of dealing with the Ukraine situation are the use of force' Ukraine's Defence Minister said the US-led campaign was "no reason to be surprised" as it was already in force.

We are using our military might to defend ourselves so we can respond, he said, adding that his country already had deployed some of its armed forces in eastern and southern Ukraine. "It is clear that we are not going to use our military might. It's a no-brainer to use our military might to defend ourselves so we can respond." Ukraine has said it will not be armed with the Russian army's arsenal if Russia is not satisfied with its actions.
US President Barack Obama described Monday's move as "the biggest military exercise yet" on the part of Russia by a third of the US military in Europe.
